content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a Julia function that wraps a string at a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    wrapped_text *= current_line

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how to use this function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output the wrapped text, with each line not exceeding the specified width.
